channel.title: Server back online!
channel.description:
We rolled back 2 hours before the last rollback, now everything should be back to normal, if you want more security so your forum account is never compromised, set a new password just for minecraft here:
http://www.moparcraft.net/smf/index.php?action=profile;area=forumprofile

item.title: Server back online!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:39, topic:410776”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=512043.msg3721161#msg3721161 date=1313948009]
You probably want to fix your quote, regardless, records are currently kept for 2 weeks, but that might change.
[/quote]

Its inevitable to have a quote not mess up all the time, there should be a body for the post you are quoting and a separate message body you are typing yourself so there is no more mistakes like that[/quote]
If you want to see mistakes, try using the mobile theme on Android with Opera Mini under a low service area (I mean barely enough to get internet) while at work. I get blank posts, triple text, and random times where it sends the first character of each word.

Read full topic

item.title: Server back online!
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:36, topic:410776”][quote author=zuppers link=topic=512043.msg3720160#msg3720160 date=1313883287]

Maybe he wasn’t typing it in right? Can anyone else let me know if it works for you?
[/quote]He said he was able to get the dirt block from the command but when used it would not show anything. Not even the nothing found message.

it sends 2 messages, one saying searching for a match, and one saying something along the lines of nothing found or information on the block modified.

On a side note, how long does it cache the changes to the blocks, still 2 days i guess?
I’m not sure if it’s supposed to say ‘nothing found’ or not.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Server back online!
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“Spankr Poodle, post:28, topic:410776”]Now that the server is back up, I’ve got a question. BigBrother isn’t there anymore, and I would like to know how I could figure out who has been grieving the outside of my place. Is there a way to do so?[/quote]You should be able to use /hawk I’m not sure tho, as mitb didn’t really mention if regular users had access.

Seems like /hawk tool doesn’t work for regular users.

Read full topic

item.title: Server back online!
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:21, topic:410776”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=512043.msg3716964#msg3716964 date=1313702643]

What about to this point?
http://www.moparcraft.net/smf/index.php/topic,511167.msg3710059.html#msg3710059

The problem is I know that previous to that, the person who stole the passwords had been logging into staff accounts. So who knows what they rolled back/banned/muted etc etc?

I found out that 2 hours before that mark is fine, exactly at this time:
2011-08-13T03:40:01-05:00

So that is when we will roll back to, should be up soon, I’ll post here when it is.

Set your minecraft server passwords while I’m working!
[/quote]

you rolled back too much i lost some work that i did and by some i mean alot[/quote]
Same here, I did a shitton of work, and there’s no possible way I’m gonna do it again.

Read full topic
